intro: Amphiblemma lanceatum, commonly known as the lanceolate amphiblema, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in green or reddish bracts. Amphiblemma lanceatum is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it an important component of its ecosystem.
